channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: If confirmed as HHS secretary, RFK Jr. would have a vast global reach
item.description: As confirmation hearings begin for RFK Jr. nomination as secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services, many are focused on domestic agenda. The agency has a vast global scope as well.
item.content:encoded:
As confirmation hearings begin for RFK Jr. nomination as secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services, many are focused on domestic agenda. The agency has a vast global scope as well.

(Image credit: WASHINGTON, DC - FEBRUARY 09: The sun flares next to the sign marking the headquarters building of the US Department of Health and Human Services on February 9, 2024, in Washington, D.C.)
item.dc:creator: Simar Bajaj

item.title: Trump signs executive order taking aim at DEI programs in the military
item.description: Trump said the diversity programs discourage merit and leadership, and discriminate on the basis of race and sex. The directive was among a series of orders that seeks to reshape the U.S. military.
item.content:encoded:
Trump said the diversity programs discourage merit and leadership, and discriminate on the basis of race and sex. The directive was among a series of orders that seeks to reshape the U.S. military.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: News for Trump: Denmark's last envoy to Greenland says U.K. may have first dibs
item.description: Denmark's last minister for Greenland says Britain once claimed right of first refusal over the territory — because of its proximity to Canada, which Britain once ruled.
item.content:encoded:
Denmark's last minister for Greenland says Britain once claimed right of first refusal over the territory — because of its proximity to Canada, which Britain once ruled.

(Image credit: Felipe Dana)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: A museum's confession: why we have looted objects
item.description: An exhibition at San Francisco's Asian Art Museum points to a burgeoning trend: museums are engaging the public more openly around efforts to repatriate artifacts looted from other countries.
item.content:encoded:
An exhibition at San Francisco's Asian Art Museum points to a burgeoning trend: museums are engaging the public more openly around efforts to repatriate artifacts looted from other countries.

(Image credit: Kevin Candland)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Doctors opposing RFK Jr. rally in the lead-up to his confirmation
item.description: Many health professionals are lining up against Trump's pick for health secretary. They say his anti-vaccine views could cost lives. Some of his supporters embrace his stance.
item.content:encoded:
Many health professionals are lining up against Trump's pick for health secretary. They say his anti-vaccine views could cost lives. Some of his supporters embrace his stance.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Ukraine uses souped-up Soviet-era weapons to defend a vital river from Russia
item.description: As Ukraine's line of defense grows thin, this unit is using a modernized Soviet-era vehicle to stop Russian forces from crossing the river and taking Kherson.
item.content:encoded:
As Ukraine's line of defense grows thin, this unit is using a modernized Soviet-era vehicle to stop Russian forces from crossing the river and taking Kherson.

(Image credit: Anton Shtuka for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Melania Trump is back in the White House for her second act as first lady
item.description: The role of first lady is unelected, unpaid, and usually comes with zero preparation. But Melania Trump is back in the White House with the most experience someone in her position can have.
item.content:encoded:
The role of first lady is unelected, unpaid, and usually comes with zero preparation. But Melania Trump is back in the White House with the most experience someone in her position can have.

(Image credit: Greg Nash)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Big reveals are unlikely in Trump-ordered Kennedy and MLK document drops, experts say
item.description: Historians say the Trump-ordered release of more information on the killings of President John F. Kennedy, Robert F. Kennedy and Martin Luther King Jr., could be interesting but unlikely to rewrite history.
item.content:encoded:
Historians say the Trump-ordered release of more information on the killings of President John F. Kennedy, Robert F. Kennedy and Martin Luther King Jr., could be interesting but unlikely to rewrite history.

(Image credit: AFP)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Danish leader on European tour as nation moves to boost presence around Greenland
item.description: Denmark's prime minister went on a tour of European capitals Tuesday as Europe faces what she called "a more uncertain reality" and her country moves to strengthen its military around Greenland.
item.content:encoded:
Denmark's prime minister went on a tour of European capitals Tuesday as Europe faces what she called "a more uncertain reality" and her country moves to strengthen its military around Greenland.

(Image credit: Antti Aimo-Koivisto)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: USAID officials put on leave for allegedly not abiding by executive order
item.description: A message to USAID staff, obtained by NPR, says it will analyze "actions within USAID that appear to be designed to circumvent the President's Executive Order" freezing most foreign aid.
item.content:encoded:
A message to USAID staff, obtained by NPR, says it will analyze "actions within USAID that appear to be designed to circumvent the President's Executive Order" freezing most foreign aid.

(Image credit: Celal Gunes/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis
